reasoning: The test was looking for a 'Migration Tool' UI that never existed - Content Layout Migration is an automatic background upgrade process triggered through IUpgradeable.UpgradeModule(), not a user-facing feature. The feature description's UI Location was simply incorrect.
evidence_summary: Screenshots show a fully functional Evoq CMS with no errors. The Settings menu, Site Behavior tabs, and Scheduler all work correctly but contain no Migration Tool because it was never designed as a UI feature - it's an automatic database migration that runs during module upgrade from legacy ContentLayouts table to the new architecture.
scenario_id: ContentLayout::Content Layout Migration::Verify Migration Tool UI Existence
